intro: Dimeria mooneyi subsp. borii, commonly known as the Borri's dimeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid environments. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology compared to other dimeria species.
